sen.j: 小倉 遊亀（おぐら ゆき、1895年3月1日 - 2000年7月23日）は、日本画家。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA (March 1, 1895 - July 23, 2000) was a Japanese-style ('nihonga' in Japanese) painter.
Yuki OGURA (March 1, 1895 - July 23, 2000) was a Japanese-style painter.
sen.cmt: took out "('nihonga' in Japanese)" as it is extra info
sen.e: Yuki OGURA (March 1, 1895 - July 23, 2000) was a Japanese-style painter.

sen.j: 本名、ゆき。
sen.e: Her real name was Yuki (which was written in hiragana, whereas her pseudonym was written as "遊亀" in kanji, literally meaning the playing turtle).
Her real name was Yuki.
sen.cmt: *I took out the bracket part as it is said "遊亀は本名" in the later part of this file. quotation for meaning
sen.e: Her real name was Yuki.

sen.j: 旧姓、溝上。
sen.e: Yuki's birth name was Yuki MIZOUE.
Yuki's birth name was Yuki MIZOUE.
Yuki's birth name was Yuki MIZOUE.

sen.j: 滋賀県生れ。
sen.e: Yuki was born in Shiga Prefecture.
She was born in Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: I think just saying "she" is ok instead of saying "Yuki" every time
sen.e: She was born in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 奈良女子高等師範学校（現奈良女子大学）卒。
sen.e: Yuki graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).
sen.cmt: wikiサイト上に、奈良女子高等師範学校卒とあり、奈良女子大学はリンク先表示でしたので、原文を修正のうえ訳出しました。ご確認願います。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%80%89%E9%81%8A%E4%BA%80
sen.e: She graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).
She graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).

sen.j: 1926年に院展に入選し、1932年に女性として初めて日本美術院の同人となる。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA was accepted for the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition (popularly called 'In-ten' in Japanese) in 1926, and became the first female member of a coterie fine art gallery of the Japan Academy of Fine Arts (which is called 'Nihon bijutsuin' in Japanese) in 1932.
sen.cmt: 日本美術院の正式英語名称は特にない為、ブリタニカの表記に準じました。http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/300967/Japan-Academy-of-Fine-Arts
sen.e: She received a prize in In-ten (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) in 1926, and became the first female member of 'Nihon bijutsuin' (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts) in 1932.
She received a prize in In-ten (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) in 1926, and became the first female member of 'Nihon bijutsuin' (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts) in 1932.

sen.j: 色彩に富む人物画や静物画が特徴で、上村松園とともに日本を代表する女流画家。
sen.e: Characterized by colorful figure and still-life paintings, Yuki OGURA is a leading Japanese female painter, along with Shoen UEMURA.
Characterized by colorful portraits and still-life paintings, she is a leading Japanese female painter, along with Shoen UEMURA.
Characterized by colorful portraits and still-life paintings, she is a leading Japanese female painter, along with Shoen UEMURA.

sen.j: 作「O夫人坐像」「小女」「浴女その一」など。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA's works included "O-fujin Zazo" (Portrait of Mrs. O), "Shojo" (Girl), and "Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1).
sen.cmt: 作品名英語表記は全て、国立美術館データベースに準じました。http://search.artmuseums.go.jp/records.php?sakuhin=2134 http://www.momat.go.jp/Honkan/list20060530.html 原文「浴女」に「その一」を補足の上訳出しました。「浴女その二」はまた異なる英語名称があります。
sen.e: Yuki's works included "O-fujin Zazo" (Portrait of Mrs. O), "Shojo" (Girl), and "Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1).
Yuki's works included "O-fujin Zazo" (Portrait of Mrs. O), "Shojo" (Girl), and "Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1).

sen.j: 1895年3月1日、滋賀県大津市丸屋町に生まれる。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA was born on March 1, 1895, in Maruya-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Yuki was born on March 1, 1895, in Maruya-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: took out OGURA as her birth name is different
sen.e: Yuki was born on March 1, 1895, in Maruya-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: （旧姓・溝上（みぞうえ）、遊亀は本名）。
sen.e: (Her birth name was Yuki MIZOUE, and therefore Yuki was her real name.)
(Her birth name was Yuki MIZOUE, and therefore Yuki was her real name.)
(Her birth name was Yuki MIZOUE, and therefore Yuki was her real name.)

sen.j: 1913年滋賀県立大津高等女学校（現・滋賀県立大津高等学校）入学、1917年、奈良女子高等師範学校（現・奈良女子大学）卒業。
sen.e: In 1913 Yuki OGURA entered the Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu Girls' High School (present-day Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School), and in 1917 she graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).
sen.cmt: 原文「高等師範」を「高等師範学校」と補足修正しました。滋賀県立大津高等学校の公式英語名称では大津をOhtsuと表記しますので、そのように訳出しました。http://www.ohtsu-h.shiga-ec.ed.jp/
sen.e: In 1913 she entered the Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu Girls' High School (present-day Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School), and in 1917 she graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).

In 1913 she entered the Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu Girls' High School (present-day Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School), and in 1917 she graduated from Nara Women's Higher Normal School (present-day Nara Women's University).

sen.j: 女子高で国文学を教えるかたわら、1920年より安田靫彦に師事。
sen.e: While teaching Japanese literature at a girls' high school, Yuki started studying Japanese-style painting under Yukihiko YASUDA since 1920.
While teaching Japanese literature at a girls' high school, she started studying under Yukihiko YASUDA IN 1920.
sen.cmt: Yuki -> Shepreposition/ took out "Japanese-style painting" as it is extra info
sen.e: While teaching Japanese literature at a girls' high school, she started studying under Yukihiko YASUDA IN 1920.

sen.j: 1926年に「胡瓜」が院展に入選する。
sen.e: In 1926, Yuki's "Kyuri" (Cucumbers) was accepted for the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition.
In 1926, her painting "Kyuri" (Cucumbers) received a prize in the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition.
In 1926, her painting "Kyuri" (Cucumbers) received a prize in the Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition.

sen.j: 以後1998年に「椿三題」を出品するまで連続入選。
sen.e: Thereafter, Yuki continued being accepted every year until "Tsubaki Sandai" (literally, Camellia, three themes) of 1998.
Thereafter, Yuki received prizes in the exhibition every time it was held until "Tsubaki Sandai" (literally, Camellia, three themes) of 1998.
Thereafter, Yuki received prizes in the exhibition every time it was held until "Tsubaki Sandai" (literally, Camellia, three themes) of 1998.

sen.j: 1932年、女性として初めて日本美術院同人となり、1936年に山岡鉄舟門下の小倉鉄樹と結婚。
sen.e: In 1932 Yuki OGURA became the first female member of a coterie fine art gallery of the Japan Academy of Fine Arts, and in 1936 she married Tetsuki OGURA who studied under Tesshu YAMAOKA.
In 1932 she became the first female member of 'Nihon bijutsuin' (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts), and in 1936 she married Tetsuki OGURA who studied under Tesshu YAMAOKA.
In 1932 she became the first female member of 'Nihon bijutsuin' (the Japan Academy of Fine Arts), and in 1936 she married Tetsuki OGURA who studied under Tesshu YAMAOKA.

sen.j: 以後鎌倉に住む。
sen.e: After the marriage, Mr. and Mrs. Ogura lived in Kamakura.
After their marriage, Mr. and Mrs. Ogura lived in Kamakura.
After their marriage, Mr. and Mrs. Ogura lived in Kamakura.

sen.j: 1976年日本芸術院会員、1978年に文化功労者に選ばれる。
sen.e: In 1976 Yuki OGURA was selected to become a member of Japan Art Academy ('Nihon Geijutsuin' in Japanese), and was chosen Person of Cultural Merit in 1978.
In 1976 Yuki OGURA was selected to become a member of 'Nihon Geijutsuin' (the Japan Art Academy), and was chosen as a Person of Cultural Merit in 1978.
In 1976 Yuki OGURA was selected to become a member of 'Nihon Geijutsuin' (the Japan Art Academy), and was chosen as a Person of Cultural Merit in 1978.

sen.j: 1980年には上村松園についで女性画家として二人目の文化勲章を受章。
sen.e: In 1980 Yuki OGURA was conferred the Order of Cultural Merit, being the second female painter thus honored after Shoen UEMURA.
In 1980 she was conferred the Order of Cultural Merit, being the second female painter thus honored after Shoen UEMURA.
In 1980 she was conferred the Order of Cultural Merit, being the second female painter thus honored after Shoen UEMURA.

sen.j: 1990年から96年まで日本美術院理事長を務めた。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA served as the chairperson of the Board of Directors of the Japan Academy of Fine Arts from 1990 to 1996.
Yuki served as the chairperson of the Board of Directors of the Japan Academy of Fine Arts from 1990 to 1996.
Yuki served as the chairperson of the Board of Directors of the Japan Academy of Fine Arts from 1990 to 1996.

sen.j: 1999年にはパリで個展を開いた。
sen.e: Yuki OGURA held a solo exhibition in Paris in 1999.
She held a solo exhibition in Paris in 1999.
She held a solo exhibition in Paris in 1999.

sen.j: 105歳の長寿を全うして、2000年に鎌倉で没している。
sen.e: At the age of 105, Yuki OGURA died in Kamakura in 2000.
At the age of 105, she died in Kamakura in 2000.
At the age of 105, she died in Kamakura in 2000.

sen.j: 奈良女子大学の講堂の緞帳は、小倉遊亀の「爛漫」、滋賀県立大津高等学校の体育館の緞帳は「うす霜」という原画によるものである。
sen.e: The curtains of the auditorium of Nara Women's University were designed based on Yuki OGURA's "Ranman" (literally, cherry blossoms full in bloom), and likewise, the curtains of the gymnasium of Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School were designed based on her "Usushimo" (literally, thin frost).
sen.cmt: 作品名は定訳不明。「爛漫」等、画像参考： http://www.artm.pref.hyogo.jp/news/press/pdf/press_y010114.pdf
sen.e: The curtains of the auditorium of Nara Women's University were designed based on her painting "Ranman" (literally, in full bloom), and likewise, the curtains of the gymnasium of Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School were designed based on her "Usushimo" (literally, thin frost).

The curtains of the auditorium of Nara Women's University were designed based on her painting "Ranman" (literally, in full bloom), and likewise, the curtains of the gymnasium of Shiga Prefectural Ohtsu High School were designed based on her "Usushimo" (literally, thin frost).

tit.cmt: took out ":" as the original sentence doesn't have it

sen.j: - 「O夫人坐像」などで第4回上村松園賞
sen.e: - Awarded the 4th Shoen UEMURA Prize for works including the "Portrait of Mrs. O."
- Awarded the 4th Shoen UEMURA Prize for works including the "Portrait of Mrs. O."
- Awarded the 4th Shoen UEMURA Prize for works including the "Portrait of Mrs. O."

sen.j: - 「裸婦」（第39回院展出品）で芸術選奨美術部門文部大臣賞
sen.e: - "Rafu" (A Woman in the Nude) (Exhibited at the 39th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) was awarded an Art Encouragement Prize (Art Department, Minister of Education's Prize).
sen.cmt: 題名および賞の定訳不明
sen.e: - "Rafu" (Female Nude) (exhibited at the 39th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) was awarded an Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts in art area.
- "Rafu" (Female Nude) (exhibited at the 39th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) was awarded an Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts in art area.

sen.j: - 「小女」（第41回院展出品）で第8回毎日美術賞
sen.e: - "Shojo" (Girl) (exhibited at the 41st Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) received the 8th Mainichi Art Award.
- "Shojo" (Girl) (exhibited at the 41st Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) received the 8th Mainichi Art Award.
- "Shojo" (Girl) (exhibited at the 41st Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) received the 8th Mainichi Art Award.

sen.j: - 「母子」（第46回院展出品）で第18回日本芸術院賞
sen.e: - "Boshi" (Mother and Child) (exhibited at the 46th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) won the 18th Japan Art Academy Award.
sen.cmt: 原文「母子」の読み不明。「おやこ」かもしれませんが確認出来ません。
sen.e: - "Boshi" (Mother and Child) (exhibited at the 46th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) won the 18th Japan Art Academy Award.
- "Boshi" (Mother and Child) (exhibited at the 46th Japan Academy of Fine Arts Exhibition) won the 18th Japan Art Academy Award.

sen.j: - 神奈川文化賞
sen.e: - Kanagawa Culture Award
- Kanagawa Cultural Award
- Kanagawa Cultural Award

sen.j: - 滋賀県文化賞
sen.e: - Shiga Prefectural Cultural Prize
- Shiga Prefectural Cultural Prize
- Shiga Prefectural Cultural Prize

sen.j: 主な作品

Major Works

sen.j: 浴女その一（1938年、東京国立近代美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1) (1938, owned by The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)
sen.cmt: 題名の読み・定訳は美術館所蔵品リストによる。原文に「その一」を補足・訳出しました。
sen.e: "Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1) (1938, owned by The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)
"Yokujo Sonoichi" (Bathing Women 1) (1938, owned by The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo)

sen.j: 受洗を謳う（1936年、滋賀県立近代美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Jusen o Utau" (literally, Singing the Praises of Baptism) (1936, owned by The Museum of Modern Art, Shiga)
"Jusen o Utau" (literally, Singing the Praises of Baptism) (1936, owned by The Museum of Modern Art, Shiga)
"Jusen o Utau" (literally, Singing the Praises of Baptism) (1936, owned by The Museum of Modern Art, Shiga)

sen.j: 観世音菩薩（1941年、滋賀県立近代美術館蔵）
sen.e: "Kanzeon Bosatsu" (literally, the Buddhist Goddess of Mercy, the Kannon) (1941, owned by The Museum of Modern Art, Shiga)
"Kanzeon Bosatsu" (literally, the Buddhist Goddess of Mercy, the Kannon) (1941, owned by The Museum of Modern Art, Shiga)

sen.e: "Maiko" (Maiko Maiden, meaning Apprentice Geisha) (1969, owned by The National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto)
sen.cmt: 題名の読み・定訳は美術館所蔵品リストによる。
